hook.text: Maurice Sendak's picture book was pulled from libraries because adults thought it would give children nightmares.

buildup.text: Published in 1963, Where the Wild Things Are shows a boy sent to bed who imagines sailing to an island of monsters.

discovery.text: Psychologists warned it was too dark. Librarians said monsters would terrify young readers.

punchline.text: Adults feared the monsters. Children wanted to be their king.

quiz.question: Why was Where the Wild Things Are initially challenged?
